news.title: Man admits to unlawful killing of pensioner Tom Niland (73) five days into trial
news.summary: Five days into his trial for the unlawful killing of 73-year-old Tom Niland, who was beaten in his home and left to die by three men, John Irving this morning changed his plea to guilty.

news.title: Election fraudster works for Healy-Rae family firm, Minister told
news.summary: A Senator has called for an investigation after he claimed a man who pleaded guilty to electoral fraud works a company run by the Healy-Rae family dynasty.

news.title: Woman (40s) quizzed over Steven O’Meara’s murder suspected of ordering brutal killing
news.summary: A woman being questioned over the savage killing of Steven O’Meara, who was buried alive 16 years ago, is suspected of ordering the murder.

news.title: UCC student claims father was ‘thrown down flight of stairs’ during illegal eviction
news.summary: A court has ordered a landlord to pay €7,100 to a tenant who was illegally evicted while undergoing his first-year college exams.

news.title: Andy Farrell names eight Irish players for Lions first Test as Australia lose key man for Brisbane battle
news.summary: Andy Farrell has named eight Irish starters for the Lions’ first Test against Australia at Suncorp Stadium in Brisbane on Saturday (11am Irish time), with three more on the bench.

news.title: Revealed: Just two children have had urgent spinal operations abroad despite ministerial order
news.summary: Just two children in need of urgent spinal surgeries have received treatment abroad so far this year, despite a legal instruction to the HSE to provide all children with scoliosis the option to travel.

news.title: ‘Unsustainable’ absenteeism has become a significant risk to An Post’s future, annual report claims
news.summary: “Unsustainable levels of absenteeism” are cited in An Post’s annual report as one of the principal risks and uncertainties facing the semi-state company.

news.title: ‘I was reading last week about a guy who had 10 remote jobs – and he was earning more than $1.5m a year’
news.summary: Fake CVs are now a thing, according to Declan Murphy. Cheats are using AI bots to clone the skills of other people, and then firing off hundreds, even thousands, of applications for remote-working jobs.

news.title: The Open: Shane Lowry makes his move in Royal Portrush
news.summary: It’s a massive week in Royal Portrush as the 153rd Open Championship takes place.

news.title: Senan Molony: Catherine Connolly speaks softly, but is it more schtick than a stick she’s carrying at launch of her presidential run?
news.summary: Teddy Roosevelt is credited with the maxim “speak softly and carry a big stick”. Would-be president of Ireland Catherine Connolly emulates that American leader only in one respect. She speaks very softly indeed.
